script: If you're planning to process that massive data export this afternoon, I really wouldn't recommend using the standard server route. As a matter of fact, the primary database is completely blocked off right now due to some unexpected emergency maintenance. Because of that major system delay, you'll definitely need to use a slight detour through our backup servers. I'd actually highly suggest waiting to run the report until tomorrow morning if possible. It might be a minor inconvenience, but it will absolutely ensure your data doesn't get corrupted.

options: To provide an undeniable, factual warning that explains why a certain action is highly inadvisable.
To aggressively complain that the IT department never finishes maintenance on schedule.
To boast about knowing a secret server command that no other support agent knows.
To excitedly invite the user to watch the system updates happen in real time.
question.prompt: Why does the support agent use the phrase 'As a matter of fact'?

explanation: The speaker uses 'As a matter of fact' to firmly introduce a concrete, undeniable piece of reality that significantly impacts the user's workflow.
